repnme.cdata!: Haiti - Road Maintenance and Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is highly
            unsatisfactory, sustainability unlikely, with negligible
            institutional development impacts. Similarly, ratings on
            Bank performance reflect unsatisfactory results, largely due
            to inadequacies in the initial project design in addressing
            institutional constraints, and the weak supervision of
            project activities, while the Borrower's performance
            reflects highly unsatisfactory ratings, based on numerous
            difficulties encountered during implementation. Lessons
            first address the need to balance implementation, sector
            objectives, and social impacts, particularly under
            post-conflict situations where important trade-offs among
            these three aspects in project design, and intervention
            readiness, means understanding the related costs and
            benefits, and mitigation risks. Second, in the absence of
            governance and institutional framework, it is necessary to
            rely on well-defined implementation shortcuts that bypass
            traditional government channels, but tailored to
            implementation capacity. This leads to the need to
            reformulate managerial, and administrative practices for
            asset management, to maximize existing capabilities, ensure
            greater transparency, while allowing tighter monitoring, and
            supervisory criteria. In addition, the need to improve aid
            coordination, specifically in project design for roads,
            should incorporate an integrated approach, that focuses on
            economic, and social priorities.

18156800.theme: Other financial and private sector development,Infrastructure services for private sector development
18156800.trustfund:
TF033950-HAITI - ROAD MAINTENANCE AND REHABILITATION,TF034856-HAITI - ROAD MAINTENANCE AND
            REHABILITATION PROJECT

repnme.cdata!: Haiti - Road Maintenance and Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Road Maintenance
            and Rehabilitation Project are to: 1) assist the Government
            in implementing a comprehensive five-year road maintenance
            and rehabilitation program on the intercity road network and
            in Port-au-Prince; 2) strengthen road sub-sector management
            within a comprehensive restructuring program of the
            Ministry; 3) foster private sector and community
            participation in road works and 4) assist the Government in
            increasing its financing of road maintenance. The project
            will comprise: bridge and road rehabilitation works to be
            contracted out; periodic and routine maintenance works to be
            carried out by local firms, and local communities and the
            Ministry of Public Works' (MTPTC) force account;
            limited procurement of traffic control and road maintenance
            equipment and tools; and an institutional strengthening
            component. This last component will be aimed at: 1)
            restructuring the MTPTC; 2) improving transport planning and
            sector policy; 3) training MTPTC staff to prepare projects
            for private sector implementation and to manage contracts;
            and 4) preparing studies aimed at resolving
            sector/sub-sector issues.
